tool.name: qiime2 feature-table core-features

param.name: table
param.label: table: FeatureTable[Frequency]
param.help: [required] The feature table to use in core features calculations.

param.name: min_fraction
param.label: min_fraction: Float % Range(0.0, 1.0, inclusive_start=False)
param.help: [default: 0.5] The minimum fraction of samples that a feature must be observed in for that feature to be considered a core feature.

param.name: max_fraction
param.label: max_fraction: Float % Range(0.0, 1.0, inclusive_end=True)
param.help: [default: 1.0] The maximum fraction of samples that a feature must be observed in for that feature to be considered a core feature.

param.name: steps
param.label: steps: Int % Range(2, None)
param.help: [default: 11] The number of steps to take between `min_fraction` and `max_fraction` for core features calculations. This parameter has no effect if `min_fraction` and `max_fraction` are the same value.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: feature-table core-features ==================================== Identify core features in table
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Identify "core" features, which are features observed in a user-defined fraction of the samples. Since the core features are a function of the fraction of samples that the feature must be observed in to be considered core, this is computed over a range of fractions defined by the `min_fraction`, `max_fraction`, and `steps` parameters.
|
